questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 14 centimeters and a width of 6 centimeters. What is the area, in square centimeters, of this rectangle?
questions.explanation: The area of a rectangle is calculated as <math><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>l</mi><mi>w</mi></math>. Substituting the given values: <math><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>84</mn></math> square centimeters.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize basic area formulas for rectangles, triangles, and circles to save time on easy questions.

questions.question: If <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: First, subtract 9 from both sides: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. Dividing by 2 gives <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>. Alternatively, solve for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and then multiply by 2.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Read the question carefully. It asks for the value of <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, not <math><mi>x</mi></math>.

questions.question: A right rectangular prism has a length of 5 meters, a width of 3 meters, and a height of 8 meters. What is the volume, in cubic meters, of the prism?
questions.explanation: The volume of a rectangular prism is <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>l</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>h</mi></math>. Substituting the values: <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn></math> cubic meters.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Ensure you are distinguishing between volume (cubic units) and surface area (square units).

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: A bag contains red and blue marbles in a ratio of 2 to 5. If there are 35 blue marbles, how many red marbles are in the bag?
questions.explanation: The ratio of Red to Blue is <math><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>. Let <math><mi>x</mi></math> be the number of red marbles. Then <math><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>35</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>. Multiplying both sides by 35 gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Set up a proportion <math><mfrac><mi>part</mi><mi>part</mi></mfrac></math> or <math><mfrac><mi>part</mi><mi>whole</mi></mfrac></math> to solve ratio problems systematically.

questions.question: A right circular cylinder has a volume of <math><mn>192</mn><mi>π</mi></math> cubic inches and a height of 3 inches. What is the radius, in inches, of the base of the cylinder?
questions.explanation: The volume formula is <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>h</mi></math>. Substituting knowns: <math><mn>192</mn><mi>π</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Divide by <math><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></math>: <math><mn>64</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Taking the square root, <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a question provides volume in terms of <math><mi>π</mi></math>, solving usually involves canceling <math><mi>π</mi></math> from both sides early in the process.

questions.question: The figure shows a right triangle with legs of length 12 units and 16 units. What is the area, in square units, of the triangle?
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M 50 150 L 250 150 L 50 50 Z' fill='transparent' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='50' y='130' width='20' height='20' fill='transparent' stroke='black'/><text x='130' y='170' font-family='Arial' font-size='16'>16</text><text x='20' y='110' font-family='Arial' font-size='16'>12</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle with vertical leg labeled 12 and horizontal leg labeled 16.
questions.explanation: The area of a triangle is <math><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>h</mi></math>. For a right triangle, the legs serve as base and height. <math><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>96</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In right triangles, the two legs are always perpendicular, so one is the base and the other is the height.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question:
The system of equations below has exactly one solution (x,y).
3x+2y=16
y=x+3
What is the value of x?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> into the first equation: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. Simplify: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math> <math><mo>→</mo></math> <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math> <math><mo>→</mo></math> <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Substitution is often faster than elimination when one variable is already isolated.

questions.question: What are the solutions to the equation <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: By the zero product property, set each factor to zero: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember that if <math><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math> is a factor, the root is <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></math>.

questions.question: A bag contains 5 red, 7 blue, and 8 green balls. If one ball is chosen at random, what is the probability that the ball is NOT blue?
questions.explanation: Total balls = <math><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. The number of balls that are not blue is <math><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn></math>. The probability is <math><mfrac><mn>13</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For 'NOT' probability questions, you can calculate <math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>event</mi><mo>)</mo></math> or simply count the favorable outcomes directly.

questions.question: Triangle ABC is similar to triangle DEF. The perimeter of triangle ABC is 24, and the perimeter of triangle DEF is 36. If the length of side AB is 6, what is the length of the corresponding side DE?
questions.explanation: The ratio of perimeters of similar triangles is equal to the ratio of corresponding side lengths. The ratio is <math><mfrac><mn>36</mn><mn>24</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn></math>. Therefore, side DE is <math><mn>1.5</mn></math> times side AB: <math><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Establish the scale factor <math><mi>k</mi></math> first. <math><mi>Perimeter</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, <math><mi>Side</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, but <math><mi>Area</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

questions.question: Circle A has a radius of <math><mi>r</mi></math>. Circle B has a radius of <math><mn>2.5</mn><mi>r</mi></math>. The area of Circle B is <math><mi>k</mi></math> times the area of Circle A. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Area of A is <math><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Area of B is <math><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>6.25</mn><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. The ratio is 6.25.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a linear dimension scales by a factor of <math><mi>c</mi></math>, the area scales by <math><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

questions.question: A right circular cone has volume <math><mi>V</mi></math>. A second cone has a height that is 20% greater than the first cone and a radius that is 10% less than the first cone. Which expression represents the volume of the second cone?
questions.explanation: Original volume <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>h</mi></math>. New radius is <math><mn>0.9</mn><mi>r</mi></math>, new height is <math><mn>1.2</mn><mi>h</mi></math>. New Volume <math><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.9</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>0.81</mn><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.81</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.972</mn><mi>V</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Apply percentage changes as decimals (e.g., 20% increase = 1.2) directly to the variables in the formula.

questions.question: A cube has a surface area of 294 square centimeters. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of the cube?
questions.explanation: Surface area of a cube is <math><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. <math><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>294</mn><mo>→</mo><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>49</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. Volume is <math><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>7</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>343</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Know the difference between <math><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> (surface area) and <math><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math> (volume) for cubes.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='20' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='250' x2='280' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='270' y='265' font-family='serif' font-size='14'>x</text><text x='35' y='30' font-family='serif' font-size='14'>y</text><text x='50' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='100' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>1</text><text x='150' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>2</text><text x='200' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>3</text><line x1='45' y1='210' x2='55' y2='210' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='215' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>8</text><line x1='45' y1='170' x2='55' y2='170' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='175' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>16</text><line x1='45' y1='90' x2='55' y2='90' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='95' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>32</text><path d='M 50 230 C 65 230 85 220 100 210 S 135 185 150 170 S 185 120 200 90' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none'/><circle cx='50' cy='230' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='60' y='230' font-size='12'>(0, 4)</text><circle cx='100' cy='210' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='110' y='205' font-size='12'>(1, 8)</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Graph of an exponential function in the first quadrant. The curve starts low on the y-axis and rises steeply to the right, passing through the explicitly marked points (0, 4) and (1, 8).
questions.question: The graph of the function <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi></math> is shown. If <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi></msup></math>, where <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>a</mi></math> and <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>b</mi></math> are constants, what is the value of <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Using the point <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, substitute into the equation: <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>0</mn></msup></math>. Since <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>0</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, we get <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Now substitute the second point <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></math> into <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi></msup></math>: <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>1</mn></msup></math>, which simplifies to <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. The function is <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi></msup></math>. To find the value at <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, calculate <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></math>.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='20' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='250' x2='280' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='270' y='265' font-family='serif' font-size='14'>x</text><text x='35' y='30' font-family='serif' font-size='14'>y</text><text x='50' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='100' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>1</text><text x='150' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>2</text><text x='200' y='265' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>3</text><line x1='45' y1='210' x2='55' y2='210' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='215' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>8</text><line x1='45' y1='170' x2='55' y2='170' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='175' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>16</text><line x1='45' y1='90' x2='55' y2='90' stroke='black'/><text x='40' y='95' text-anchor='end' font-size='10'>32</text><path d='M 50 230 C 65 230 85 220 100 210 S 135 185 150 170 S 185 120 200 90' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none'/><circle cx='50' cy='230' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='60' y='230' font-size='12'>(0, 4)</text><circle cx='100' cy='210' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='110' y='205' font-size='12'>(1, 8)</text><circle cx='200' cy='90' r='5' fill='green'/><text x='210' y='90' font-size='12' fill='green' font-weight='bold'>(3, 32)</text><line x1='200' y1='250' x2='200' y2='90' stroke='green' stroke-dasharray='4' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='50' y1='90' x2='200' y2='90' stroke='green' stroke-dasharray='4' stroke-width='1'/></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: The graph of the exponential function with the point (3, 32) highlighted in green, showing the value of the function at x=3.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find the y-intercept first to determine the coefficient <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>a</mi></math> in exponential functions of the form <math xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML'><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>x</mi></msup></math>.

questions.question: Which point <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is a solution to the inequality <math><mi>y</mi><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Test choice B (2, -2): Substitute into the inequality: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math> <math><mo>→</mo></math> <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math> <math><mo>→</mo></math> <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. This statement is true, so (2, -2) is a solution.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Plug the coordinates into the inequality. If the resulting statement is true (e.g., <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>), the point is a solution.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></math> for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Simplify the denominator: <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>. The reciprocal of this is <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find a common denominator for the fractions in the denominator first, then take the reciprocal.

questions.question: If <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>169</mn></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, what is a positive value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math> into the first equation: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>169</mn></math>. <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>169</mn></math>. <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>144</mn></math>. Since we need a positive value, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recognize Pythagorean triples like 5-12-13 to solve these problems instantly.

questions.skill: Inference from sample statistics and margin of error
questions.question: A poll of 1,200 randomly selected voters showed that 42% favor Proposition A. The margin of error is 3% at a 95% confidence level. Which of the following is the most appropriate conclusion?

options.A: Exactly 42% of all voters favor Proposition A.
options.B: The true percentage of voters who favor Proposition A is likely between 39% and 45%.
options.C: We are 100% sure the percentage is between 39% and 45%.
options.D: If the sample size were increased, the margin of error would increase.

questions.explanation: A margin of error of 3% means the true population parameter is expected to be within <math><mn>42</mn><mo>%</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></math> (39% to 45%) with 95% confidence.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Margin of error describes the range of likely values for the population, not certainty for specific individuals.

questions.question: The equation <math><mi>k</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math> has no solution for <math><mi>x</mi></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: For a linear equation to have no solution, the coefficients of <math><mi>x</mi></math> must be equal, but the constants must differ. Distribute: <math><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Set coefficients equal: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Check constants: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>≠</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Thus, <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: No solution means lines are parallel (same slope/coefficient, different intercept).

questions.question: The equation of a circle in the xy-plane is <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: Complete the square for x and y. <math><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. <math><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To complete the square for <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></math>, add <math><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math> to both sides of the equation.
